title: Synthetic Recap
body:
CHARLOTTE, N.C. (AP) — On a night when baskets were a precious commodity, one man authored a performance for the ages. Alonzo Mourning, a force of sheer will and power, dragged the Charlotte Hornets to a gritty 93-86 victory over the Houston Rockets, delivering a career-defining 41 points that echoed through a defensively-charged arena.

This was not a game of finesse; it was a bruising battle in the paint, and Mourning was its undisputed king. While shooters faltered, the Hornets' center was a model of brutal efficiency, imposing his dominance from the opening tip. His 41-point masterpiece stood in stark contrast to the struggling offenses around him, single-handedly outscoring entire quarters of the Rockets' attack.

Houston, despite a valiant 22-point effort from Clyde Drexler, had no answer for the onslaught. The Rockets scrapped and clawed, but every run was met with an authoritative answer from Mourning in the post—a thunderous dunk, a soft turnaround, or a trip to the free-throw line he earned through sheer physicality.

While Glen Rice provided crucial support with 21 points, this night belonged solely to one man. Mourning’s historic output was the bedrock of the win, a testament to an unstoppable individual effort overcoming a collective offensive struggle. In a season of memorable games, this was Mourning’s magnum opus—a Herculean feat that lifted his team on his broad shoulders and carried them across the finish line.
